title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 171-3.3 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 171-3.3 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Privileged
mail. Any item of correspondence to or from those persons (titles) or entities
listed below: (1)
any United States or New

York State Government Official; (2)
any member of the United States Congress; (3)
any member of the New York State

Legislature; (4)
any Judge of any

Federal or New York State Court; Note: This does not include Town Justice Court. (5)
the resident's attorney of
record or legal representative (law guardian); (6)
the commissioner of the New York State

Office of Children and Family Services; (7)
any deputy commissioner of the New York

State Office of Children and Family Services; and
(8)
an ombudsman of the New York State Office
of Children and Family Services. (b) Government official. The following
individuals shall be considered to be government officials: (1)

President or Vice President of the United

States; (2)
a member of the U.S. Cabinet; (3)
commissioner, chief, sheriff of a police department; (4)
commissioner of a State agency; (5)
a deputy commissioner of a State agency; and
(6)
a district attorney or a representative
of an assistant district attorney. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
171-3.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
